New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player to hit 50 homers and steal 50 bases in the same season
No player in baseball history had hit three homers and stolen multiple bases in a game until Ohtani did it on Thursday

No player had ever had a 10-RBI day, a six-hit day, a five extra-base hit day, a three-homer day, and a multi-steal day within their career. Ohtani crammed all that production into a single Thursday afternoon
Key Match Events: Ohtani went 6-for-6, slugged three home runs, drove in 10 runs and swiped two bases in a game that clinched a postseason berth for the Dodgers
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a 20-4 thrashing of the Miami Marlins
Others: The article discusses the greatness of Shohei Ohtani's performance and compares it to other great individual offensive performances in baseball history
